result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (5th or 6th) and Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th). The defendant was found guilty of both charges. Because Wisconsin law provides for only one penalty even if there is a conviction on both, no additional penalty has been imposed as a result of the second charge.

  • Ricardo A. Gonzalez was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).
  • Ricardo A. Gonzalez was found guilty of Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: THE DEPARTMENT OF CORRECTIONS SHALL DEDUCT RESTITUTION AND ALL OTHER COURT OBLIGATIONS AT THE RATE OF 25% OF ALL MONIES RECEIVED WHILE INCARCERATED.

superMiscConds.notes:
Pay $3,000.00 fine plus costs and Department of Corrections Supervision Fees.   If the defendant is discharged from Extended Supervision with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment may be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.
-----------------------------------

Not to possess or consume alcohol.  Not to possess any controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.  Not to operate a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license. Not to operate any motor vehicle that is not properly equipped with an IID. 
-----------------------------------

Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge. 
Must complete Victim Impact Panel.
-----------------------------------

AODA assessment and follow through with recommendations.
-----------------------------------

supervisions.notes: Comply with A & R - Intoxicated Driver Assessment and Driver Safety Plan

**11/20/2015 - Transcript, Motion Hearing, Part II - FILED; Court Reporter:  Janet Schulz (df)

Defendant Ricardo A. Gonzalez in court, in custody with attorney Melissa Nepomiachi.  Diane M. Donohoo appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Matter before the Court on Motion to Withdraw as Counsel. Argument by Atty. Nepomiachi and response by ADA Donohoo. Court addresses defendant as to reasons why he wants a new attorney. Court goes over speedy trial rights and potential issues with granting of the motion and continuing the case. Attorney Nepomiachi requests matter be set over to the 1:15 call so she can speak to defendant in person before making final decision on motion to withdraw. Minutes filed.  Motion hearing scheduled for August 7, 2015 at 01:15 pm.
to Withdraw as Counsel of Record
to Withdraw as Counsel

3:26 pm  Defendant Ricardo A. Gonzalez in court, in custody with attorney Melissa Nepomiachi.  Diane M. Donohoo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  ADA Donohoo filed motion to amend Information.  Argument by Attorney Nepomiachi that amendment would be prejudicial this close to trial.  Attorney Nepomiachi also notes she just received additional discovery and she is requesting continuance of trial.  ADA Donohoo is prepared to proceed on original charges and does not want trial delayed.  Court denies State's request to amend Information and also denies defense motion to adjourn trial.  Trial remains on.   Attorney Nepomiachi advises Court that Mr. Gonzalez will be seeking to have new counsel appointed.  Minutes filed.
